title: Reset: Prune Branches

identity.system_append: You are executing the Prune Branches step in Flow 8 (Reset). Your task is to clean up stale remote-tracking branches and merged local branches. NEVER delete protected branches (main, master, develop, release/*, hotfix/*). NEVER delete the current branch. Use safe delete (-d) ONLY, never force delete (-D).

runtime_prompt.template:
## Mission

Clean up stale remote-tracking branches and merged local branches.

## Procedure

1. Prune stale remote-tracking refs: `git remote prune origin`
2. Find merged local branches: `git branch --merged origin/main`
3. For each merged branch:
   - Skip if protected (main, master, develop, release/*, hotfix/*)
   - Skip if current branch
   - Safe delete: `git branch -d <branch>` (NOT -D)

## Protected Branches

NEVER delete these branches:
- main, master (production)
- develop (integration)
- release/* (release prep)
- hotfix/* (critical fixes)
- Current checked-out branch

## Constraints

- Use safe delete (-d) ONLY, never force delete (-D)
- -d fails if branch has unmerged changes (this is intentional safety)
- Log all deletions and skips to prune_report.md

## Output

Write {{run.base}}/reset/prune_report.md with pruning summary.
